title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida A&M University
Interview Descriptions: They were very polite, although it is an extensive process with multiple interviews.  I would apply again, but it's difficult and positions rarely open.  Be prepared to show your resume and writing samples, they will look through it all and call references.
Interview Questions: What have you published?  What is your course proposal?

title: Program In Excellence STEM Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: the intervies process was very great, the questions were pretty straight forward and I didi it well. The whole interview is based on on teaching experiences . why do you want to teach, what are the skills you pocess and how will you benefit the camp
Interview Questions: why did you want to apply for the job. what's your motivation

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted online. It mostly involved questions about previous experience related to teaching, research and management projects, and how the past experience can facilitate in accomplishing the particular on-campus duties.
Interview Questions: Highlights of previous work, teaching, and research experiences, and how they connected to the current role?

title: REU Participant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida A&M University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for their Biology REU program and got an interview with one of the professors. It was a skype interview and he asked pretty general questions similar to the questions they ask during the application process and personal statement. For me, he asked why I wanted to join the Biology REU when I'm majoring in Chemical Engineering. My answers seemed sufficient since I got accepted.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to achieve and how will this REU help you?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was streamlined and I familiarized myself with the university's strategic plan for the next few years and learned how the department operates. The interview went well, they asked questions about my previous work experience, transferrable skills, willingness to learn, and customer service experience to represent the department well as the first representative.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell us a bit about your previous work experience and why you are interested in this role. 

Q: What do you know about this department? 

Q: How can you be an asset in this role and improve the functions within the work process?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: No interview process really. It was more so setting up a meeting with the professor. Once the meeting with the mentoring professor was scheduled, I was directed to complete some CITI Program modules before I could begin.
Interview Questions: What are my interest? Where do I see myself going with nutrition?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida A&M University in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process.  They were looking for someone who had qualifications and was a good fit.  Fortunately for me, I had experience on the campus.  So I was able to secure the position
Interview Questions: Basic Interview Questions

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Applications are reviewed and references are checked. From about 40 candidates about 8 and selected for a phone interview. About four are selected for an in person interview with the committee. From this, one or two candidates are hired.
Interview Questions:
What is your teaching philosophy
What is your research background

title: Campus Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Orlando, FL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by the Director of Administration and a Dean of the College of Law. Process took about 2 weeks.  State employee, so a  background check was administered.  A lot of new hire paper work was involved.
Interview Questions: Q:  Are your able to multitask?

title: Assistant Project Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was hosted by a panel. I enjoyed that I had many likenesses as the interviewers so it was easy and comfortable for me to respond. They were very professional and their questions were clear but challenging .
Interview Questions: Why FAMU and the vied position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was Quick and to the point,Customer service questions,How to handle difficult situations,How to do you handle confidential material,How to handle disagreements with higher management,Salary start,Benefits,How does your last employer feel about you .Approximately 10  questions with 3 three interviewers.
Interview Questions: What Experience did I have

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview process. The process took 3 weeks. Interview process involves a panel of advisor ms from different departments. It was a round table interview where each interviewer took turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Tell something about yourself, how will you be able to contribute to the role of an advisor, etc.

title: Assistant Professor, Mathematics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The entire Mathematics Interview process is Very Very slow compared to other Universities and/or HBCU that I previously interviewed with.  The Interview Process was broken down into the following parts: Credential screening and ranking of potential candidates; The Top-Candidates (~9-15 people) are offered a Recorded Phone Interview with the math department search/screen committee members;  The Top-Candidates (~6-12 people) are invited to FAMU campus to give a research talk and teaching talk and to "mingle" with the current faculty/staff;  At this point, allegedly the Top-Candidates names are forwarded to the Dean's office and you will have two phone interviews.  One phone interview will deal with your track record and other general questions.  The second phone interview will be focus around your salary expectations.  However, beware the Dean and associates will use all spare nothing for the sake of low balling you.  Be firm with your minimum salary expections others you will be poorly compensated as long as you work at FAMU.  The admin only give themselves market value raises and/or bonus.  Everyone else typically gets nothing.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply here?

title: Assistant Professor, Architecture Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a day-long interview process.  I arrived the night before and a faculty member who was part of the interview committee came to pick me up from the airport and took me to the hotel.  We had dinner together that night at a local restaurant.  Next morning, after checking out from the hotel, I was picked up from there by the same faculty member who I had met the day before. He took me around the campus, the school of architecture and its various facilities. Next I met a group of students for an hour. The meeting with the faculty search committee happened over the lunch.  Next I had to deliver a lecture on a topic of my choice to the whole school of architecture.  The interview process ended with a meeting with the assistant dean.
Interview Questions: How would I resolve the issue when a student comes to me with a grade I had given that they are not happy with?

title: Career Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a Skype interview with a panel of four interviewers.  Interview started 15 minutes late.  Traditional questions like "What are your strengths?"  "What are your weaknesses?"  I found the Skype panel format a bit awkward.
Interview Questions: Define what a supervisor is.

title: Chief Justice Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: You're interviewed by your classmates so its not that bad, they ask you basic things about the job that they ask you to study for ahead of time. Overall it was a fairly easy interview, the peers weren't that bad if someone had vendetta with you that could sway the opinions of others like in any other situation
Interview Questions: What's the difference between fair and just

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida A&M University in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was hired thanks to a friend of mine who recommended me for this position. Although the paperwork was initially tricky, everything got worked out. The interim dean who hired me was very friendly. I very much love working at this school.
Interview Questions: There really wasn't a formal interview for this position...it was more subtly. I was asked if I would be able to teach on the periphery of my content area.

title: Visiting Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview that took 30 to 45 minutes maximum. Questions were mainly about my teaching philosophy and how to handle large classes of students.  I interviewed with the department chair over the phone.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy

title: Community Outreach Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was lengthy in terms of paper work being processed for pay, but after that I started work and everything went smoothly. The interview was very relaxed. The director was very nice and relatable.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that qualifies you for this position?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was unnecessarily long. We went over several questions that had a little to do with what I was actually being interviewed for. The interview asked about the clothes I had on and why I chose to wear them that way as well as why I chose to wear my hair the way I did. I ended up getting the job regardless thogu
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The application process was pretty easy and straightforward. After that you are invited to a carousel in which you are "watched" and evaluated by members of Residence Life. Some of the tasks are individual and others are in a group. The tasks seem a bit strange, but the purpose is to see how flexible you are with different materials and situations given, sort of as a sample of what you will experience once hired. After the carousel of activities you are shortly interviewed by three individuals.
Interview Questions: There's a young person, a mother, and an elderly lady in a sinking boat. Who do you save?

title: As An Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida A&M University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: they just asked me the numbers of hours i can do . that was it
Interview Questions: why do you want work for us
